intro: Prunella × hybrida, commonly known as selfheal, is a flowering plant in the mint family (Lamiaceae). It is a hybrid species resulting from crosses between Prunella vulgaris and Prunella lanceolata. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, featuring square stems and opposite, ovate leaves with hairy surfaces. Its flowers are small, clustered in whorls, and range in color from blue to purple, blooming from late spring to early autumn. Prunella × hybrida is often found in grassy areas, along roadsides, and in disturbed soils, and it is known for its medicinal properties.
